title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement jonthegeek@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to rapid
text: outlines propose change rapid.

title: Contributing to rapid
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to rapid
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to rapid
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("jonthegeek/rapid", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to rapid
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to rapid
text: Please note rapid project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with rapid
text: Thanks using rapid! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with rapid
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Getting help with rapid
text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. ’s question: ’s best ask R4DS Online Learning Community Slack. options include Posit Community, StackOverflow. people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with rapid
text: ’ll try look issue soon can, packages maintained volunteers. good reprex particularly important might weeks months initial report start working . can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix !

title: rapid design principles
text: experiment making key package design principles explicit, versus implicit code. goal make maintenance easier, spread time across people. idea copied usethis.

title: rapid design principles
text: ’ve gone back forth “api_{class}” “{class}” class names. rule seems emerging add “api_” necessary, try . rule still might change. also belatedly noticed server() (singular) OAS specification servers(). belatedly updated . careful match class names pluralization specification.

text: name identifying name contact person/organization. email email address contact person/organization. must form email address. url URL pointing contact information. must form URL.

text: api_contact S7 object, fields name, email, url.

title: Contact information for the API — api_contact
code: api_contact(   "API Support",   "support@example.com",   "https://www.example.com/support" ) #> <rapid::api_contact> #>  @ name : chr "API Support" #>  @ email: chr "support@example.com" #>  @ url  : chr "https://www.example.com/support"

title: Information about the API — api_info

title: Information about the API — api_info
text: contact contact information exposed API, generated via api_contact(). description description API. CommonMark syntax may used rich text representation. license license information exposed API, generated via api_license(). summary short summary API. terms_of_service URL Terms Service API. must form URL provided. title title API. version version API document (distinct OpenAPI Specification version API implementation version).

title: Information about the API — api_info
text: api_info S7 object.

title: Information about the API — api_info
code: api_info() #> <rapid::api_info> #>  @ contact         : <rapid::api_contact> #>  .. @ name : chr(0)  #>  .. @ email: chr(0)  #>  .. @ url  : chr(0)  #>  @ description     : chr(0)  #>  @ license         : <rapid::api_license> #>  .. @ name      : chr(0)  #>  .. @ identifier: chr(0)  #>  .. @ url       : chr(0)  #>  @ summary         : chr(0)  #>  @ terms_of_service: chr(0)  #>  @ title           : chr(0)  #>  @ version         : chr(0)  api_info(   title = "My Cool API",   license = api_license(     name = "Apache 2.0",     url = "https://opensource.org/license/apache-2-0/"   ) ) #> <rapid::api_info> #>  @ contact         : <rapid::api_contact> #>  .. @ name : chr(0)  #>  .. @ email: chr(0)  #>  .. @ url  : chr(0)  #>  @ description     : chr(0)  #>  @ license         : <rapid::api_license> #>  .. @ name      : chr "Apache 2.0" #>  .. @ identifier: chr(0)  #>  .. @ url       : chr "https://opensource.org/license/apache-2-0/" #>  @ summary         : chr(0)  #>  @ terms_of_service: chr(0)  #>  @ title           : chr "My Cool API" #>  @ version         : chr(0)

title: R API definition object — rapid
code: rapid() #> <rapid::rapid> #>  @ info   : <rapid::api_info> #>  .. @ contact         : <rapid::api_contact> #>  .. .. @ name : chr(0)  #>  .. .. @ email: chr(0)  #>  .. .. @ url  : chr(0)  #>  .. @ description     : chr(0)  #>  .. @ license         : <rapid::api_license> #>  .. .. @ name      : chr(0)  #>  .. .. @ identifier: chr(0)  #>  .. .. @ url       : chr(0)  #>  .. @ summary         : chr(0)  #>  .. @ terms_of_service: chr(0)  #>  .. @ title           : chr(0)  #>  .. @ version         : chr(0)  #>  @ servers: <rapid::servers> #>  .. @ url        : chr(0)  #>  .. @ description: chr(0)  #>  .. @ variables  : <rapid::server_variable_list>  list() rapid(   info = api_info(title = "A", version = "1"),   servers(     url = "https://development.gigantic-server.com/v1"   ) ) #> <rapid::rapid> #>  @ info   : <rapid::api_info> #>  .. @ contact         : <rapid::api_contact> #>  .. .. @ name : chr(0)  #>  .. .. @ email: chr(0)  #>  .. .. @ url  : chr(0)  #>  .. @ description     : chr(0)  #>  .. @ license         : <rapid::api_license> #>  .. .. @ name      : chr(0)  #>  .. .. @ identifier: chr(0)  #>  .. .. @ url       : chr(0)  #>  .. @ summary         : chr(0)  #>  .. @ terms_of_service: chr(0)  #>  .. @ title           : chr "A" #>  .. @ version         : chr "1" #>  @ servers: <rapid::servers> #>  .. @ url        : chr "https://development.gigantic-server.com/v1" #>  .. @ description: chr(0)  #>  .. @ variables  : <rapid::server_variable_list>  list() rapid(   info = api_info(title = "A", version = "1"),   servers(     url = c(       "https://development.gigantic-server.com/v1",       "https://staging.gigantic-server.com/v1",       "https://api.gigantic-server.com/v1"     ),     description = c(       "Development server",       "Staging server",       "Production server"     )   ) ) #> <rapid::rapid> #>  @ info   : <rapid::api_info> #>  .. @ contact         : <rapid::api_contact> #>  .. .. @ name : chr(0)  #>  .. .. @ email: chr(0)  #>  .. .. @ url  : chr(0)  #>  .. @ description     : chr(0)  #>  .. @ license         : <rapid::api_license> #>  .. .. @ name      : chr(0)  #>  .. .. @ identifier: chr(0)  #>  .. .. @ url       : chr(0)  #>  .. @ summary         : chr(0)  #>  .. @ terms_of_service: chr(0)  #>  .. @ title           : chr "A" #>  .. @ version         : chr "1" #>  @ servers: <rapid::servers> #>  .. @ url        : chr [1:3] "https://development.gigantic-server.com/v1" ... #>  .. @ description: chr [1:3] "Development server" "Staging server" ... #>  .. @ variables  : <rapid::server_variable_list>  list()

what: A server variable for server URL template substitution — server_variable
title: A server variable for server URL template substitution — server_variable
text: Server variable properties used substitution server’s URL template.

title: A server variable for server URL template substitution — server_variable
code: server_variable(   name = character(),   default = character(),   ...,   enum = NULL,   description = character() )

title: A server variable for server URL template substitution — server_variable
text: name Character vector (required). names variables. default Character vector (required). default value use substitution variable, shall sent alternate value supplied. Note behavior different Schema Object’s treatment default values, cases parameter values optional. enum defined, value must exist enum’s values. ... dots future extensions must empty. enum List (potentially empty) character vectors (optional). enumeration string values used substitution options limited set. description Character vector (optional). optional description server variable. CommonMark syntax may used rich text representation.

title: A server variable for server URL template substitution — server_variable
text: server_variable S7 object, fields name, default, enum, description.

title: A server variable for server URL template substitution — server_variable
code: server_variable(   "username",   "demo",   enum = c("demo", "other"),   description = "The active user's folder." ) #> <rapid::server_variable> #>  @ name       : chr "username" #>  @ default    : chr "demo" #>  @ enum       :List of 1 #>  .. $ : chr [1:2] "demo" "other" #>  @ description: chr "The active user's folder."

code: server_variable_list(   list(server_variable(), server_variable()) ) #> <rapid::server_variable_list> List of 2 #>  $ : <rapid::server_variable> #>   ..@ name       : chr(0)  #>   ..@ default    : chr(0)  #>   ..@ enum       : list() #>   ..@ description: chr(0)  #>  $ : <rapid::server_variable> #>   ..@ name       : chr(0)  #>   ..@ default    : chr(0)  #>   ..@ enum       : list() #>   ..@ description: chr(0)

code: servers(   url = class_missing,   description = class_missing,   variables = class_missing )

title: A collection of server variables for multiple servers — servers
text: url list server_variable() objects. description list server_variable() objects. variables server_variable_list() object.

title: A collection of server variables for multiple servers — servers
text: servers S7 object, properties url, description, variables.

title: A collection of server variables for multiple servers — servers
code: servers(   url = c(     "https://development.gigantic-server.com/v1",     "https://staging.gigantic-server.com/v1",     "https://api.gigantic-server.com/v1"   ),   description = c(     "Development server",     "Staging server",     "Production server"   ) ) #> <rapid::servers> #>  @ url        : chr [1:3] "https://development.gigantic-server.com/v1" ... #>  @ description: chr [1:3] "Development server" "Staging server" "Production server" #>  @ variables  : <rapid::server_variable_list>  list() servers(   url = "https://{username}.gigantic-server.com:{port}/{basePath}",   description = "The production API server",   variables = server_variable_list(server_variable(     name = c("username", "port", "basePath"),     default = c("demo", "8443", "v2"),     description = c(       "The active user's folder.",       NA, NA     ),     enum = list(       NULL,       c("8443", "443"),       NULL     )   )) ) #> <rapid::servers> #>  @ url        : chr "https://{username}.gigantic-server.com:{port}/{basePath}" #>  @ description: chr "The production API server" #>  @ variables  : <rapid::server_variable_list> List of 1 #>  .. $ : <rapid::server_variable> #>  ..  ..@ name       : chr [1:3] "username" "port" "basePath" #>  ..  ..@ default    : chr [1:3] "demo" "8443" "v2" #>  ..  ..@ enum       :List of 3 #>  .. .. .. $ : NULL #>  .. .. .. $ : chr [1:2] "8443" "443" #>  .. .. .. $ : NULL #>  ..  ..@ description: chr [1:3] "The active user's folder." NA NA
